intro: Lachnagrostis deflexa, commonly known as the bentgrass, is a flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a low-growing perennial grass that typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, creeping stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often bent or curled. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming dense inflorescences that are characteristic of the genus. Lachnagrostis deflexa is often found in wetland areas and is adapted to environments with high moisture levels.
